docs.snippet: An insanely melodramatic, extra-inning affair in the World Series pushed both teams into the embrace of exhaustion before Chicago was crowned king....
docs.lead_paragraph: An insanely melodramatic, extra-inning affair in the World Series pushed both teams into the embrace of exhaustion before Chicago was crowned king.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports of The Times column recounts Game 7 of World Series between Chicago Cubs and Cleveland Indians--an ugly, yet exciting finale.

headline.main: Twitchy, Sweaty, but Triumphant: Cubs Go Home as Winners at Last
headline.print_headline: An Exhalation of Delight After a Century of Lament

docs.snippet: Authorities are looking into whether Andrey Baranov conspired with American marathon organizers to allow athletes using banned substances to compete in their events....
docs.lead_paragraph: Authorities are looking into whether Andrey Baranov conspired with American marathon organizers to allow athletes using banned substances to compete in their events.
docs.abstract: Russians sports agent Andrey Baranov denies engaging in any criminal activity, as federal law enforcement officials are looking into whether he conspired with organizers of New York City Marathon to allow athletes using banned substances to compete; investigation is part of broader inquiry that has found Russian athletes and officials guilty of doping or aiding in doping.

headline.main: Russian Sports Agent and U.S. Marathon Officials Under Federal Investigation
headline.print_headline: Russian Doping Inquiry Reaches U.S. Shores

docs.lead_paragraph: Joe Louis, which will be torn down after the Redwings move out next year, is one of a tiny number of high-profile stadiums or arenas named for an athlete.
docs.abstract: Detroit Red Wings begin their final season at Joe Louis Arena, one of tiny number of high-profile stadiums or arenas named for athlete; most arenas are named after sponsors to bring in addition revenue.

headline.main: Not-So-Ordinary ‘Joe’: Final Round for an Arena Named for an Athlete
headline.print_headline: A Not-So-Ordinary ‘Joe’: An Arena Named for an Athlete

docs.snippet: Russia, whose track and field athletes were banned from the Rio Olympics after disclosures of a state-sponsored doping scandal, has brought in a law which makes inducement to doping a criminal offense, according to the RIA Novosti news agency....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russia, whose track and field athletes were banned from the Rio Olympics after disclosures of a state-sponsored doping scandal, has brought in a law which makes inducement to doping a criminal offense, according to the RIA Novosti news agency.

headline.main: New Law in Russia Criminalizes Inducement to Doping: RIA Novosti
headline.print_headline: New Law in Russia Criminalizes Inducement to Doping: RIA Novosti
